page.title: 12Block D5-D6 (and D4 cont)
page.content: {D4 (Continued) -Valley for the dreaded coal dust that caused the miners scourge - pneumoconiosis. {Block D5.}An area of rough pasture land scattered farmstead and street -dwellings.It is crossed by the parish boundary."Meiri-hirion" (standing- stones) can be seen on Waunboeth land. {Block D6.}This area contains the most-densely populated section of the whole area.The majority of houses were built by the Local Authority;one estate,Ffordd Aneurin,being built especially for miners who came into the valley from Durham when their own mines were closed in 1968.The boundary between Pontyberem and Bancffosfelin lies within this block.It also contains Capel Caersalem,a Welsh Independent Chapel and the village's new primary school.
